p: RVA infections were present throughout the year over the period of the two years of surveillance (2015â€“2016), with highest prevalence in dry winter season. During 2015, the highest number of RVA positive cases (37%) were observed in dry winter months (January-March, 37%) of the year followed by (October-December, 29.4%). Similarly, RVA infections peaked with 53% positive cases in dry winter months (October-December) of the year 2016( Fig 2).
